events.originalText: A train derailment and collision in the West Midnapore district of West Bengal, India, caused the deaths of at least 148 passengers.
events.subtitle: Jnaneswari Express train derailment
events.headline: Train derailment in West Bengal, India kills 148 passengers

events.originalText: An independent commission appointed by the Football Association voted two-to-one to allow Wimbledon F.C. to relocate from London to Milton Keynes.
events.subtitle: The Football Association
events.headline: Wimbledon F.C. approved to relocate to Milton Keynes

events.originalText: The Pakistan Atomic Energy Commission carried out five underground nuclear tests, becoming the seventh country in the world to successfully develop and publicly test nuclear weapons.
events.subtitle: Pakistan Atomic Energy Commission
events.headline: Pakistan conducts underground nuclear tests

events.originalText: Mathias Rust, a West German aviator, flew his Cessna 172 from Helsinki, Finland, through Soviet air defences, landing illegally near Red Square in Moscow.
events.subtitle: Mathias Rust
events.headline: West German aviator lands illegally near Red Square in Moscow

events.originalText: Second World War: Belgium surrendered to Nazi Germany, ending the Battle of Belgium.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Belgium surrenders to Nazi Germany in Second World War

events.originalText: The rise of Neville Chamberlain culminated with his accession as Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.
events.subtitle: Rise of Neville Chamberlain
events.headline: Neville Chamberlain becomes Prime Minister of the United Kingdom

events.originalText: Scottish-American preservationist John Muir (pictured) founded the environmental organization Sierra Club in California.
events.subtitle: John Muir
events.headline: John Muir founds Sierra Club in California

events.originalText: U.S. president Andrew Jackson signed the Indian Removal Act into law, authorizing him to negotiate with Native Americans for their removal from their ancestral homelands.
events.subtitle: Andrew Jackson
events.headline: Andrew Jackson signs Indian Removal Act into law

events.originalText: French and Indian War: Led by 22-year-old George Washington, a company of Virginia colonial militiamen ambushed a force of 35 Canadiens at the Battle of Jumonville Glen (depicted).
events.subtitle: French and Indian War
events.headline: George Washington leads ambush at Battle of Jumonville Glen

events.originalText: English Civil War: Royalist troops stormed and captured the Parliamentarian stronghold of Bolton, leading to a massacre of defenders and local residents.
events.subtitle: English Civil War
events.headline: Royalist troops capture Bolton in English Civil War

events.originalText: Italian composer Claudio Monteverdi debuted his second opera L'Arianna, now one of his lost works, at a royal wedding in Mantua.
events.subtitle: Claudio Monteverdi
events.headline: Claudio Monteverdi debuts L'Arianna at royal wedding in Mantua

events.originalText: Tang forces led by Li Shimin defeated and captured Dou Jiande at the Battle of Hulao in the civil war that followed the collapse of the Sui dynasty.
events.subtitle: Tang dynasty
events.headline: Tang forces defeat Dou Jiande at Battle of Hulao

events.originalText: According to the Greek historian Herodotus, a solar eclipse, accurately predicted by Thales of Miletus, abruptly ended the Battle of Halys between the Lydians and the Medes.
events.subtitle: 580s BC
events.headline: Thales of Miletus predicts solar eclipse ending Battle of Halys
